<SysML>
  <System>
    <SystemName>CouplingSystem</SystemName>
    <SystemAbstract>
      <Description>
        This system models the coupling system between a vehicle and a trailer.
        The system consists of one vehicle and one trailer, which are connected via a coupling mechanism.
        The vehicle does not possess a coupling ball but connects by referencing the ball within the hitch component.
        The trailer is bound to the connector in the hitch component by reference.
        This design ensures the reusability and flexible combination of each component.
        It facilitates quick adaptation and assembly of various vehicle and trailer models.
        When disconnecting or removing components, individual parts can be independently detached.
        This enhances the modularity of the coupling system and simplifies maintenance.
      </Description>
    </SystemAbstract>
    <SystemComponent>
      <ComponentName>Vehicle</ComponentName>
      <ComponentAbstract>
        <Description>
          The vehicle does not possess a coupling ball but connects by referencing the ball within the hitch component.
        </Description>

<System>
  <System.Name>VehicleWeightManagementSystem</System.Name>
  <System.Purpose>To restrict and manage the vehicle's total mass, ensuring that the overall vehicle weight does not exceed the maximum permitted limit of 2,500 kilograms.</System.Purpose>
  <System.Requirement>
    <Requirement.Name>TotalMassRestriction</Requirement.Name>
    <Requirement.Description>The system will automatically calculate the total mass of the chassis, engine, and gearbox, and check whether this total complies with the requirement of not exceeding 2,500 kilograms.</Requirement.Description>
    <Requirement.Constraint>
      <Constraint.Type>MassConstraint</Constraint.Type>
      <Constraint.Value>2500</Constraint.Value>
    </Requirement.Constraint>
  </System.Requirement>
  <System.Component>
    <Component.Name>Chassis</Component.Name>
    <Component.Mass>
      <Mass.Value>?</Mass.Value>

<SysML>
  <Model>
    <Requirement>
      <Text>
        This system is designed to budget and constrain the mass of a vehicle, ensuring that the total mass of the complete vehicle—including major components such as the chassis, engine, and transmission—does not exceed 2,500 kilograms.
      </Text>
      <Constraint>
        <Expression>
          <Sum>
            <Variable name="chassisMass" unit="kg"/>
            <Variable name="engineMass" unit="kg"/>
            <Variable name="transmissionMass" unit="kg"/>
          </Sum>
          <ConstraintExpression>
            <LessThan>
              <Value>2500</Value>
              <SumExpression>
                <Variable name="chassisMass" unit="kg"/>
                <Variable name="engineMass" unit="kg"/>
                <Variable name="transmissionMass" unit="kg"/>
              </SumExpression>
            </LessThan>
          </ConstraintExpression>
        </Expression>

<SysML>
  <System>
    <SystemName>VehicleMassManagementSystem</SystemName>
    <SystemPurpose>Manage and regulate vehicle mass to ensure compliance with standards.</SystemPurpose>
    <SystemRequirement>
      <Requirement>
        <RequirementName>TotalMassLimit</RequirementName>
        <RequirementValue>2500</RequirementValue>
        <RequirementType>Maximum</RequirementType>
        <RequirementCondition>
          <Condition>
            <ConditionName>TotalMass</ConditionName>
            <ConditionValue>ChassisMass + EngineMass + TransmissionMass</ConditionValue>
          </Condition>
        </RequirementCondition>
      </Requirement>
    </SystemRequirement>
    <SystemComponent>
      <Component>
        <ComponentName>Chassis</ComponentName>
        <ComponentMass>ChassisMass</ComponentMass>
      </Component>
      <Component>
        <ComponentName>Engine</ComponentName>
        <ComponentMass>EngineMass</ComponentMass>
      </Component>

<System>
  <System_Requirement>
    <Requirement>
      <Text>
        The system is designed to provide end users with a convenient and efficient mode of transportation.
      </Text>
      <Constraint>
        <Text>
          Capable of supporting a driver and up to four passengers sharing a vehicle.
        </Text>
        <Text>
          Enabling them to travel safely and comfortably from the starting point to the destination.
        </Text>
        <Text>
          Users can freely enter and exit the vehicle.
        </Text>
        <Text>
          The system should ensure that this process is simple and smooth.
        </Text>
        <Text>
          The system should fully consider and integrate surrounding environmental factors.
        </Text>
        <Text>
          To ensure the safety and sustainability of the entire journey.
        </Text>
        <Text>
          Compatible with related infrastructure such as gas stations.
        </Text>
        <Text>
          The system’s operation should be centered on human needs.
